newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albanians ride derelict ship out to sea.
newsitem.headline: Albanians ride derelict ship out to sea.

text.p: Albanians desperate to flee poverty and unrest in their homeland rode a derelict freighter out of the port of Durres on Tuesday, using paddles, sea currents and sails fashioned from rubbish sacks to try to reach Italy, eyewitnesses said.
The rusting coaster had been tied up at the port for several days. Even would-be Albanian refugees doubted its seaworthiness because it had no power.
Lacking any other means to flee those aboard finally used ropes to haul the boat along the dock and then pushed off into the current.
It was so overloaded and low in the water that passengers used remnants of lumber and metal sheeting as oars to propel the craft.

About half of the people on board disembarked at the mouth of the harbour, apparently fearing it might sink. The rest, numbering perhaps a hundred, drifted out into the Adriatic to what they hope will be a better life abroad.
International rescue vessels have had to save Albanians from a number of derelict vessels adrift in the Adriatic in recent days. The people are fleeing civil unrest and poverty in their on country.
Foreign reporters saw several smaller craft, also without power, drifting out of Durres harbour on Tuesday as well.
